text: Would you mind sharing your cheese flatbread recipe?

answers.text:
@fancynannan of course but I have to admit I don't measure and add things until the consistency is right... What the locals here call agak agak and what I call eyeballing the amounts... Play with the amounts as I do a lot of eyeballing the amounts...
- teaspoon of yeast and tablespoon of sugar into about 4-6 tablespoons of warm water. Leave for about 10 min and what for it to froth a little
- add about 1/2 cup of yoghurt to warm milk and mix
- add first two mixtures together
- about 1 teaspoon of Himalayan salt into 1-2 cups of flour and make a well
- pour the wet mixture in and start kneading. Add flour until the dough stops sticking to the surface
- leave dough in oiled bowl to proof for about an hour. Cover with wet cloth
- take out dough and knead a little again and cut into balls of whatever size you wish
- gently flatten and spread the dough into long flat oblong shapes, place some cheese on half the oblong and fold over and press
- brush on some melted butter on both sides of flat bread
- heat up pan to medium-high heat (watch the bread and don't let it burn) and add some ghee or oil
- grill her up! 2-3 mins on each side and voila!  Enjoy! 😋❤️
@ozteopath lol, very Chinese method of cooking. I once asked my mom how long I should cook fish. She responded with, “until it’s cooked.”
@fancynannan hahaha I feel you!  I've asked how much of a certain ingredient to put in and I get, "until it tastes right..." Huh? 🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️😂😂😂

text: Mmmm love how juicy this looks!

answers.text: Haha.. thanks @erwiny11!  I accidentally left it in the oven for too long while I was multitasking grilling the flat bread!  Doh! 😅😅😅
